title: Toyota Bangladesh opens 1st showroom
body: Toyota Bangladesh Limited, the newest arm of Japanese automotive giant Toyota Tsusho Corporation, inaugurated its first showroom on Wednesday in Dhaka’s Tejgaon Industrial Area. The launch marks the company’s initial step toward expanding its presence in the country, officials said. At the ceremony, Premmit Singh, managing director of Toyota Bangladesh Limited, said that the showroom would reflect the company’s commitment to Toyota’s global vision and its mission to meet the evolving needs of car enthusiasts in Bangladesh. ‘Toyota Bangladesh Limited aims to provide added value and contribute to creating a more enriched society, while valuing the passion of car owners,’ Premmit said. He added that the showroom launch was just the beginning, with plans to introduce more innovations and services over the coming years. The company also emphasised its goal of sustaining growth under varying business conditions, fostering teamwork and remaining dedicated to delivering top-quality services aligned with Toyota’s global standards. Premmit stated that the company would bring facilities and innovations over the years, citing the showroom launch as just the tip of the iceberg. Company officials, automotive experts and other participants attended the showroom inauguration ceremony. On July 1, Toyota Tsusho Corporation announced a new business structure as part of its strategy to optimise operations and provide better service to customers. In a statement to the media, the company said that it was focusing on aligning its operations to better meet the evolving needs of customers and society at large in the dynamic automotive market. Toyota, one of the country’s most popular car brands, began operations in Bangladesh in 1964 through a local partnership.
